title: A Famous TV Star Lived a Long Life
summary: Elizabeth Kelly was a TV actress who lived to be 104 years old. She was best known for playing Auntie Nellie in the soap opera EastEnders. She died peacefully in Scarborough on December 31. Her agent said she had a long and successful career in television for 40 years. She also acted in other shows like Coronation Street, The Bill, and Where the Heart Is. The BBC, which makes EastEnders, said she was a kind person and they will miss her. She started acting in the late 1960s and played Nellie from 1993 to 1998, with one last appearance in 2000. This article tells us about her life and how people remember her.

background_read: Elizabeth Kelly was an actress from England who worked on TV for a long time. She was born in Newcastle and started acting in the late 1960s. She became famous for playing Nellie Ellis in EastEnders, a popular British soap opera that many people watch. Soap operas are TV shows with stories that continue over many episodes, often about families and friends. Elizabeth Kelly's role as Auntie Nellie made her well-loved by fans. She also appeared in other shows like Coronation Street, which is another famous British soap. This article helps us learn about her life and how she contributed to entertainment.
Article_Structure: WHO: Elizabeth Kelly, a former TV actress known for playing Nellie Ellis in EastEnders
WHAT: She died at age 104, and the article shares details about her career and tributes from the BBC
WHERE: She died in Scarborough, and she acted in shows filmed in the UK
WHY: To inform people about her passing and celebrate her long acting career

perspectives.description: This article focuses on honoring Elizabeth Kelly's achievements and remembering her as a kind and talented actress.
